page.title: 01BEADNELL VILLAGE
page.content:
BEADNELL VILLAGE
Designated as an area of outstanding natural beauty,Beadnell is noted for fine beaches and a safe bay extending 2 miles with a small harbour over shadowed by 18th century lime kilns now owned by the National Trust. There are cobles for fishing,sailing boats,wind surfing and water ski-ing for tourists. In the village is the Church, an old pele tower now part of the Craster Arms,1 hotel,2 shops,one of these incorporates take away fish and chips and cafe. 73% of the houses are week_end or holiday homes + 450 static caravans & a camping site. One Dairy farm and 5 arable farms in our area with good grazing and cultivated fields.
